title: Logical connective
summary: In logic, a logical connective (also called a logical operator, sentential connective, or sentential operator) is a logical constant. They can be used to connect logical formulas. For instance in the syntax of propositional logic, the binary connective ∨ {\displaystyle \lor } can be used to join the two atomic formulas P {\displaystyle P} and Q {\displaystyle Q} , rendering the complex formula P ∨ Q {\displaystyle P\lor Q} .
